greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of sum_{n >= 1} (2n)!/(1!*2!*...*n!).
comment: Let t(n) = (2n)!/(1!*2!*...*n!). Then t(n) is an integer for n = 1..5, and max{t(n), n >= 1} = t(4) = 140... . It appears that t(n) < 10^(-6) for n > 9.
mathematica: NSum[(2 n)!/BarnesG[n+2], {n, 1, Infinity}, WorkingPrecision -> 103] // RealDigits // First (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 19 2015 *)
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Oct 13 2014
